decks.notes: The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while filtering through the deck with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the necessary answers. Terminus and Unexpectedly Absent are used as board wipe options, while Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels provide additional win conditions. Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in reusing key spells from the graveyard, ensuring that the deck maintains control over the game in the long run.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and counter spells in order to out-value the opponent and secure victory. The deck also utilizes graveyard interaction with cards like Gurmag Angler and Deathrite Shaman to gain advantage and keep up with the opponent's threats. The mana base is designed to provide access to a variety of colors for the spells in the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around control and resource management to outplay the opponent and secure the win.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of powerful disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach, Abrupt Decay, and Toxic Deluge, while also generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix. The deck also utilizes a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor to out-value opponents in longer games. Overall, the key idea is to control the game and grind out incremental advantages to eventually win the game.

The core strategy of this deck is to maintain control of the game through a combination of disruption spells like Force of Will and Daze, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to stabilize the board with powerful threats like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic, while also generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. The inclusion of key cards like Umezawa's Jitte, Sword of Fire and Ice, and Batterskull provide additional utility and win conditions to help close out games.

This Legacy Aggro deck revolves around playing cheap threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler early on, while disrupting the opponent's game plan using cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The deck also includes efficient cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key cards and maintain card advantage. By utilizing the life loss from cards like Street Wraith and fetch lands, the deck aims to power up Death's Shadow to keep up the pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly.

The deck focuses on ramping out powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly using lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple. It aims to disrupt opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Endless One. The inclusion of utility lands like Karakas and Mishra's Factory gives the deck additional versatility and resilience. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient threats and disruptive elements, creating a fast-paced and impactful gameplay experience.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures combined with disruptive elements to control the opponent's board and resources. It aims to efficiently use mana acceleration and powerful creatures like Thalia, Stoneforge Mystic, and Knight of the Reliquary to quickly apply pressure and close out games. The inclusion of hate cards like Gaddock Teeg and Qasali Pridemage further disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Swords to Plowshares provide removal and protection. The deck also utilizes graveyard interaction with Deathrite Shaman and Scavenging Ooze for additional value.

This Grixis Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and discard effects. The deck is centered around powerful cards like Snapcaster Mage and Baleful Strix, which provide card advantage and board presence. Leovold, Emissary of Trest helps to punish the opponent for drawing cards, while Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and control. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows the deck to cast its spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and value through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. It also aims to efficiently deal with threats using removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command. The mana base is designed to support casting a variety of spells, including powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana of the Veil. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption, card advantage, and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies while deploying threats of its own. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, Phyrexian Revoker, and Rishadan Port to slow down the opponent's plans, while also utilizing Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to quickly bring out powerful creatures and equipment. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Mother of Runes, while also applying pressure with creatures like Mirran Crusader and Flickerwisp. The goal is to outmaneuver opponents through a combination of disruption and aggression.

The key concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage. By using powerful spells like Force of Will and Kolaghan's Command, along with versatile threats like Snapcaster Mage and Leovold, Emissary of Trest, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. Additionally, cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help the player dig for crucial cards, while Deathrite Shaman provides mana acceleration and graveyard disruption. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control and winning the game through incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, and Grim Lavamancer. This is supported by efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fire / Ice, as well as disruptive spells like Stifle and Daze. The deck also includes powerful card draw and manipulation tools such as Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe, ensuring consistency and the ability to adapt to different situations in the game. The mana base is streamlined with utility lands like Wasteland and fetch lands to ensure smooth mana development.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Delver of Secrets, along with disruptive spells like Hymn to Tourach and Force of Will, to quickly take control of the game. The deck also has powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope to provide additional value. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells while also utilizing Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain control of the board to secure a victory.

The main concept of the deck is to aggressively play powerful Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible by utilizing mana acceleration from lands like Ancient Tomb and Eldrazi Temple. Cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer provide strong threats and disruption while cards like Chalice of the Void and Umezawa's Jitte help control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with early threats and powerful creatures, quickly closing out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will, as well as disruptive cards like Daze and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. The deck also aims to efficiently tutor for equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull using Stoneforge Mystic, while utilizing mana ramp from Noble Hierarch and Deathrite Shaman. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis provides a strong threat that is difficult for opponents to deal with. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive lands like Wasteland to further control the game.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, hand disruption, and card advantage. The deck aims to maintain control of the board with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command, while also generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Leovold, Emissary of Trest. By disrupting the opponent's resources and game plan, the deck can slowly grind out a win through card advantage and efficient threats like Gurmag Angler and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.
